00122 #ifndef MEMORY_H
00123 #define MEMORY_H
00124 
00125 #ifdef __cplusplus
00126 extern "C" {
00127 #endif
00128 
00129 #include <stdio.h>
00130 
00131 #include "host.h"
00132 #include "misc.h"
00133 #include "machine.h"
00134 #include "options.h"
00135 #include "stats.h"
00136 
00137 /* number of entries in page translation hash table (must be power-of-two) */
00138 #define MEM_PTAB_SIZE    (256*1024)
00139 #define MEM_LOG_PTAB_SIZE  18
00140 #define MAX_LEV                 3
00141 
00142 
00143 /* log2(page_size) assuming 4KB pages */
00144 #define PAGE_SIZE 4096
00145 #define PAGE_SHIFT 12
00146 
00147 /* this maps a virtual address to a low address where we're
00148    pretending that the page table information is stored.  The shift
00149    by PAGE_SHIFT yields the virtual page number, the masking is
00150    just to hash the address down to something that's less than the
00151    start of the .text section, and the additional offset is so that
00152    we don't generate a really low (e.g., NULL) address.
00153    WE KEEP THE SAME INTERFACE FOR QEMU WHERE WE ASSUME ALL PAGE TABLES ARE MAPPED IN A LOWER MEMORY AREA
00154    ANY TLB MISS GOES TO THIS ADDRESS FOR FETCHING THE PHYSICAL PAGE NUMBERS
00155  */
00156 #define PAGE_TABLE_ADDR(T,A) ((((((A)>>PAGE_SHIFT)<<4)+(T)) + 0x00080000) & 0x03ffffff)
00157 #define DO_NOT_TRANSLATE (-1)
00158 
00159 
00160 /* memory access command */
00161 enum mem_cmd {
00162   Read,      /* read memory from target (simulated prog) to host */
00163   Write      /* write memory from host (simulator) to target */
00164 };
00165 
00166 /* page table entry */
00167 struct mem_pte_t {
00168   struct mem_pte_t *next;  /* next translation in this bucket */
00169   md_addr_t tag;    /* virtual page number tag */
00170   md_addr_t addr;   /* virtual address */
00171   int dirty;         /* has this page been modified? */
00172   byte_t *page;      /* page pointer */
00173   off_t backing_offset; /* offset (for fseeko) for where this page is stored in the backing file */
00174   int from_mmap_syscall; /* TRUE if mapped from mmap/mmap2 call */
00175   int no_dealloc; /* if true, do not ever deallocate/page-out to backing file */
00176 
00177   /* these form a doubly-linked list through all pte's to track usage recency */
00178   struct mem_pte_t * lru_prev;
00179   struct mem_pte_t * lru_next;
00180 };
00181 
00182 /* just a simple container struct to track unused pages */
00183 struct mem_page_link_t {
00184   byte_t * page;
00185   struct mem_page_link_t * next;
00186 };
00187 
00188 /* memory object */
00189 struct mem_t {
00190   /* memory object state */
00191   char *name;        /* name of this memory space */
00192   struct mem_pte_t *ptab[MEM_PTAB_SIZE];/* inverted page table */
00193   FILE * backing_file; /* disk file for storing memory image */
00194   off_t backing_file_tail; /* offset to allocate next page to */
00195   struct mem_pte_t * recency_lru; /* oldest (LRU) */
00196   struct mem_pte_t * recency_mru; /* youngest (MRU) */
00197 
00198   counter_t page_count;      /* total number of pages allocated (in core and backing file) */
00199 };
00200 
00201 /* memory access function type, this is a generic function exported for the
00202    purpose of access the simulated vitual memory space */
00203 typedef enum md_fault_type
00204 (*mem_access_fn)(
00205     int core_id,
00206     struct mem_t *mem,  /* memory space to access */
00207     enum mem_cmd cmd,  /* Read or Write */
00208     md_addr_t addr,  /* target memory address to access */
00209     void *p,    /* where to copy to/from */
00210     int nbytes);    /* transfer length in bytes */
00211 
00212 /*
00213  * virtual to host page translation macros
00214  */
00215 
00216 /* compute page table set */
00217 #define MEM_PTAB_SET(ADDR)            \
00218   (((ADDR) >> MD_LOG_PAGE_SIZE) & (MEM_PTAB_SIZE - 1))
00219 
00220 /* compute page table tag */
00221 #define MEM_PTAB_TAG(ADDR)            \
00222   ((ADDR) >> (MD_LOG_PAGE_SIZE + MEM_LOG_PTAB_SIZE))
00223 
00224 /* convert a pte entry at idx to a block address */
00225 #define MEM_PTE_ADDR(PTE, IDX)            \
00226   (((PTE)->tag << (MD_LOG_PAGE_SIZE + MEM_LOG_PTAB_SIZE))    \
00227    | ((IDX) << MD_LOG_PAGE_SIZE))
00228 
00229 /* locate host page for virtual address ADDR, returns NULL if unallocated */
00230 #define MEM_PAGE(MEM, ADDR, DIRTY)  mem_translate((MEM), (ADDR), (DIRTY))
00231 
00232 /* compute address of access within a host page */
00233 #define MEM_OFFSET(ADDR)  ((ADDR) & (MD_PAGE_SIZE - 1))
00234 
00235 #define MEM_ADDR2HOST(MEM, ADDR) MEM_PAGE(MEM, ADDR, 0)+MEM_OFFSET(ADDR)
00236 
00237 /* memory tickle function, allocates pages when they are first written */
00238 #define MEM_TICKLE(MEM, ADDR)            \
00239   ((!MEM_PAGE(MEM, ADDR, 0)            \
00240     ? (/* allocate page at address ADDR */        \
00241       mem_newpage(MEM, ADDR))            \
00242     : (/* nada... */ (void)0)))            
00243 
00244 /* memory page iterator */
00245 #define MEM_FORALL(MEM, ITER, PTE)          \
00246   for ((ITER)=0; (ITER) < MEM_PTAB_SIZE; (ITER)++)      \
00247     for ((PTE)=(MEM)->ptab[(ITER)]; (PTE) != NULL; (PTE)=(PTE)->next)
00248 
00249 
00250 /*
00251  * memory accessor macros
00252  */
00253 
00254 #ifdef ZESTO_ORACLE_C
00255 /* these macros are to support speculative reads/writes of memory
00256    due to instructions in-flight (uncommitted) in the machine */
00257 #define MEM_READ(MEM, ADDR, TYPE)          \
00258   (core->oracle->spec_read_byte((ADDR),&_mem_read_tmp) ? _mem_read_tmp :             \
00259   (MEM_PAGE(MEM, (md_addr_t)(ADDR),0)          \
00260    ? *((TYPE *)(MEM_PAGE(MEM, (md_addr_t)(ADDR),0) + MEM_OFFSET(ADDR)))  \
00261    : /* page not yet allocated, return zero value */ 0))
00262 
00263 #define MEM_WRITE(MEM, ADDR, TYPE, VAL)          \
00264   core->oracle->spec_write_byte((ADDR),(VAL))
00265 
00266 #define MEM_WRITE_BYTE_NON_SPEC(MEM, ADDR, VAL)          \
00267   (MEM_TICKLE(MEM, (md_addr_t)(ADDR)),          \
00268    *((byte_t *)(MEM_PAGE(MEM, (md_addr_t)(ADDR),1) + MEM_OFFSET(ADDR))) = (VAL))
00269 
00270 #else /* regular non-speculative versions... */
00271 
00272 /* safe version, works only with scalar types */
00273 /* FIXME: write a more efficient GNU C expression for this... */
00274 #define MEM_READ(MEM, ADDR, TYPE)          \
00275   (MEM_PAGE(MEM, (md_addr_t)(ADDR),0)          \
00276    ? *((TYPE *)(MEM_PAGE(MEM, (md_addr_t)(ADDR),0) + MEM_OFFSET(ADDR)))  \
00277    : /* page not yet allocated, return zero value */ 0)
00278 
00279 /* safe version, works only with scalar types */
00280 /* FIXME: write a more efficient GNU C expression for this... */
00281 #define MEM_WRITE(MEM, ADDR, TYPE, VAL)          \
00282   (MEM_TICKLE(MEM, (md_addr_t)(ADDR)),          \
00283    *((TYPE *)(MEM_PAGE(MEM, (md_addr_t)(ADDR),1) + MEM_OFFSET(ADDR))) = (VAL))
00284 #endif
00285 
00286 /* fast memory accessor macros, typed versions */
00287 #define MEM_READ_BYTE(MEM, ADDR)  MEM_READ(MEM, ADDR, byte_t)
00288 #define MEM_READ_SBYTE(MEM, ADDR)  MEM_READ(MEM, ADDR, sbyte_t)
00289 #define MEM_READ_WORD(MEM, ADDR)  MD_SWAPW(MEM_READ(MEM, ADDR, word_t))
00290 #define MEM_READ_SWORD(MEM, ADDR)  MD_SWAPW(MEM_READ(MEM, ADDR, sword_t))
00291 #define MEM_READ_DWORD(MEM, ADDR)  MD_SWAPD(MEM_READ(MEM, ADDR, dword_t))
00292 #define MEM_READ_SDWORD(MEM, ADDR)  MD_SWAPD(MEM_READ(MEM, ADDR, sdword_t))
00293 
00294 #ifdef HOST_HAS_QWORD
00295 #ifdef TARGET_HAS_UNALIGNED_QWORD
00296 qword_t MEM_QREAD(struct mem_t *mem, md_addr_t addr);
00297 #define MEM_READ_QWORD(MEM, ADDR)  MD_SWAPQ(MEM_QREAD(MEM, ADDR))
00298 #define MEM_READ_SQWORD(MEM, ADDR)  MD_SWAPQ(MEM_QREAD(MEM, ADDR))
00299 #else /* !TARGET_HAS_UNALIGNED_QWORD */
00300 #define MEM_READ_QWORD(MEM, ADDR)  MD_SWAPQ(MEM_READ(MEM, ADDR, qword_t))
00301 #define MEM_READ_SQWORD(MEM, ADDR)  MD_SWAPQ(MEM_READ(MEM, ADDR, sqword_t))
00302 #endif
00303 #endif /* HOST_HAS_QWORD */
00304 
00305 #define MEM_WRITE_BYTE(MEM, ADDR, VAL)  MEM_WRITE(MEM, ADDR, byte_t, VAL)
00306 #define MEM_WRITE_SBYTE(MEM, ADDR, VAL)  MEM_WRITE(MEM, ADDR, sbyte_t, VAL)
00307 #define MEM_WRITE_WORD(MEM, ADDR, VAL)    MEM_WRITE(MEM, ADDR, word_t, MD_SWAPW(VAL));
00308 #define MEM_WRITE_SWORD(MEM, ADDR, VAL)   MEM_WRITE(MEM, ADDR, sword_t, MD_SWAPW(VAL));
00309 #define MEM_WRITE_DWORD(MEM, ADDR, VAL)   MEM_WRITE(MEM, ADDR, dword_t, MD_SWAPD(VAL));
00310 #define MEM_WRITE_SDWORD(MEM, ADDR, VAL)  MEM_WRITE(MEM, ADDR, sdword_t, MD_SWAPD(VAL));
00311 #define MEM_WRITE_SFLOAT(MEM, ADDR, VAL)  MEM_WRITE(MEM, ADDR, sfloat_t, MD_SWAPD(VAL));
00312 #define MEM_WRITE_DFLOAT(MEM, ADDR, VAL)  MEM_WRITE(MEM, ADDR, dfloat_t, MD_SWAPQ(VAL));
00313 
00314 
00315 #ifdef HOST_HAS_QWORD
00316 #ifdef TARGET_HAS_UNALIGNED_QWORD
00317 void MEM_QWRITE(struct mem_t *mem, md_addr_t addr, qword_t val);
00318 #define MEM_WRITE_QWORD(MEM, ADDR, VAL)          \
00319   MEM_QWRITE(MEM, ADDR, MD_SWAPQ(VAL))
00320 #define MEM_WRITE_SQWORD(MEM, ADDR, VAL)        \
00321   MEM_QWRITE(MEM, ADDR, MD_SWAPQ(VAL))
00322 #else /* !TARGET_HAS_UNALIGNED_QWORD */
00323 #define MEM_WRITE_QWORD(MEM, ADDR, VAL)          \
00324   MEM_WRITE(MEM, ADDR, qword_t, MD_SWAPQ(VAL))
00325 #define MEM_WRITE_SQWORD(MEM, ADDR, VAL)        \
00326   MEM_WRITE(MEM, ADDR, sqword_t, MD_SWAPQ(VAL))
00327 #endif
00328 #endif /* HOST_HAS_QWORD */

00330 /* create a flat memory space */
00331 struct mem_t *
00332 mem_create(char *name);      /* name of the memory space */
00333 
00334 /* translate address ADDR in memory space MEM, returns pointer to host page */
00335 byte_t *
00336 mem_translate(struct mem_t *mem,  /* memory space to access */
00337     md_addr_t addr,     /* virtual address to translate */
00338     int dirty); /* should this page be marked as dirty? */
00339 
00340 /* allocate a memory page */
00341 void
00342 mem_newpage(struct mem_t *mem,    /* memory space to allocate in */
00343     md_addr_t addr);    /* virtual address to allocate */
00344 
00345 /* zero out *ALL* of memory and reset backing file info */
00346 void wipe_memory(struct mem_t * mem);
00347 
00348 /* given a set of pages, this creates a set of new page mappings,
00349  * try to use addr as the suggested addresses
00350  */
00351 md_addr_t
00352 mem_newmap(struct mem_t *mem,           /* memory space to access */
00353     md_addr_t    addr,            /* virtual address to map to */
00354     size_t       length,
00355     int mmap);
00356 
00357 /* given a set of pages, this creates a set of new page mappings,
00358  * try to use addr as the suggested addresses, but point to something
00359  * we allocated ourselves.
00360  */
00361 md_addr_t
00362 mem_newmap2(struct mem_t *mem,           /* memory space to access */
00363     md_addr_t    addr,            /* virtual address to map to */
00364     md_addr_t    our_addr,        /* our stuff (return value from mmap) */
00365     size_t       length,
00366     int mmap);
00367 
00368 /* given a set of pages, this removes them from our map.  Necessary
00369  * for munmap.
00370  */
00371 void
00372 mem_delmap(struct mem_t *mem,           /* memory space to access */
00373     md_addr_t    addr,            /* virtual address to delete */
00374     size_t       length);
00375 
00376 
00377 /* check for memory faults */
00378 enum md_fault_type
00379 mem_check_fault(struct mem_t *mem,  /* memory space to access */
00380     enum mem_cmd cmd,  /* Read (from sim mem) or Write */
00381     md_addr_t addr,    /* target address to access */
00382     int nbytes);    /* number of bytes to access */
00383 
00384 /* generic memory access function, it's safe because alignments and permissions
00385    are checked, handles any natural transfer sizes; note, faults out if nbytes
00386    is not a power-of-two or larger then MD_PAGE_SIZE */
00387 enum md_fault_type
00388 mem_access(
00389     int core_id,
00390     struct mem_t *mem,    /* memory space to access */
00391     enum mem_cmd cmd,    /* Read (from sim mem) or Write */
00392     md_addr_t addr,    /* target address to access */
00393     void *vp,      /* host memory address to access */
00394     int nbytes);      /* number of bytes to access */
00395 
00396 /* register memory system-specific statistics */
00397 void
00398 mem_reg_stats(struct mem_t *mem,  /* memory space to declare */
00399     struct stat_sdb_t *sdb);  /* stats data base */
00400 
00401 /* initialize memory system, call before loader.c */
00402 void
00403 mem_init(struct mem_t *mem);  /* memory space to initialize */
00404 
00405 /*
00406  * memory accessor routines, these routines require a memory access function
00407  * definition to access memory, the memory access function provides a "hook"
00408  * for programs to instrument memory accesses, this is used by various
00409  * simulators for various reasons; for the default operation - direct access
00410  * to the memory system, pass mem_access() as the memory access function
00411  */
00412 
00413 /* copy a '\0' terminated string to/from simulated memory space, returns
00414    the number of bytes copied, returns any fault encountered */
00415 enum md_fault_type
00416 mem_strcpy(
00417     int core_id,
00418     mem_access_fn mem_fn,  /* user-specified memory accessor */
00419     struct mem_t *mem,    /* memory space to access */
00420     enum mem_cmd cmd,    /* Read (from sim mem) or Write */
00421     md_addr_t addr,    /* target address to access */
00422     char *s);      /* host memory string buffer */
00423 
00424 /* copy NBYTES to/from simulated memory space, returns any faults */
00425 enum md_fault_type
00426 mem_bcopy(
00427     int core_id,
00428     mem_access_fn mem_fn,    /* user-specified memory accessor */
00429     struct mem_t *mem,    /* memory space to access */
00430     enum mem_cmd cmd,    /* Read (from sim mem) or Write */
00431     md_addr_t addr,    /* target address to access */
00432     void *vp,      /* host memory address to access */
00433     int nbytes);      /* number of bytes to access */
00434 
00435 
00436 /* maps each (core-id,virtual-address) pair to a simulated physical address */
00437 md_paddr_t v2p_translate(int core_id, md_addr_t virt_addr);
00438 /* given a physical address, return the corresponding core-id */
00439 int page_owner(md_paddr_t paddr);
